job_details.Vacaturetitel: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Recommendation Applications ML
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
This role is based in Amsterdam. Booking.com's Marketplace Department turns travel goals into travel realities. Our purpose? To create frictionless experiences at each and every stage of the trip. From browsing to booking and beyond, our focus is on building the connected experiences which make journeys smoother, faster and more enjoyable. Think of us as travel matchmakers, ensuring seamless integration across our product verticals to effortlessly and intuitively connect traveler preferences and actions.

   The Recommendation Applications ML team is dedicated to enhancing the overall customer experience and user journey. The team's mission is to be the centralized hub for all machine learning (ML) recommendation initiatives, providing scalable, reusable, state-of-the-art ML models. These models aim to increase relevance and personalization, enabling customers to be context-aware and make quicker, more informed decisions. Our team supports the vision of making travelers feel understood and assisted in every step of the travel booking journey. In 2025, we are planning to focus on expanding and optimizing our recommendation systems, for example by improving personalization and leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations.

   We are looking for a versatile ML expert, capable of handling all aspects from system architecture to coding, encompassing ML engineering, model design, and training. You will own the design and delivery of ML systems, from initial idea generation and collecting business requirements from product stakeholders to implementation. You will work closely together with the other Machine Learning Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers as well as with Data Engineers, Software Engineers and Product Managers., * Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines, accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining.
     * Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries. Choose the right technology or coding methodology and refactor and simplify code when necessary.
     * Take full ownership of services end-to-end by actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact. Set relevant service level objectives (SLOs) and act accordingly when they are not met.
     * Combine innovation with reuse by abstracting ML/AI concepts from one application to a generalized framework, including leveraging published research, open-source technologies, and previously-developed products at Booking.
     * Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems, as well as ML governance processes.
     * Evaluate possible architecture solutions considering business and technology requirements.
     * Contribute to the internal ML/AI community by sharing knowledge and participating in internal ML programs.
     * Coach others through evidence and clear communication, explaining advanced technical concepts in simpler terms.
     * Achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language, and practicing active listening.
     * Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies and upskilling as needed.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Recommendation Applications ML

This role is based in Amsterdam. Booking.com's Marketplace Department turns travel goals into travel realities. Our purpose? To create frictionless experiences at each and every stage of the trip. From browsing to booking and beyond, our focus is on building the connected experiences which make journeys smoother, faster and more enjoyable. Think of us as travel matchmakers, ensuring seamless integration across our product verticals to effortlessly and intuitively connect traveler preferences and actions.

   The Recommendation Applications ML team is dedicated to enhancing the overall customer experience and user journey. The team's mission is to be the centralized hub for all machine learning (ML) recommendation initiatives, providing scalable, reusable, state-of-the-art ML models. These models aim to increase relevance and personalization, enabling customers to be context-aware and make quicker, more informed decisions. Our team supports the vision of making travelers feel understood and assisted in every step of the travel booking journey. In 2025, we are planning to focus on expanding and optimizing our recommendation systems, for example by improving personalization and leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations.

   We are looking for a versatile ML expert, capable of handling all aspects from system architecture to coding, encompassing ML engineering, model design, and training. You will own the design and delivery of ML systems, from initial idea generation and collecting business requirements from product stakeholders to implementation. You will work closely together with the other Machine Learning Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers as well as with Data Engineers, Software Engineers and Product Managers., * Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines, accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining.
     * Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries. Choose the right technology or coding methodology and refactor and simplify code when necessary.
     * Take full ownership of services end-to-end by actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact. Set relevant service level objectives (SLOs) and act accordingly when they are not met.
     * Combine innovation with reuse by abstracting ML/AI concepts from one application to a generalized framework, including leveraging published research, open-source technologies, and previously-developed products at Booking.
     * Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems, as well as ML governance processes.
     * Evaluate possible architecture solutions considering business and technology requirements.
     * Contribute to the internal ML/AI community by sharing knowledge and participating in internal ML programs.
     * Coach others through evidence and clear communication, explaining advanced technical concepts in simpler terms.
     * Achieve mutually agreeable solutions by staying adaptable, communicating ideas in clear coherent language, and practicing active listening.
     * Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies and upskilling as needed.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description emphasizes the development, productionization, and maintenance of ML recommendation systems, including aspects of system architecture, ML engineering, model design, and training. While GenAI is mentioned for fine-tuning models, the core focus remains on building and deploying scalable, reusable ML models for personalization and relevance, aligning with the definition and evidence profile of an ML Engineer. The responsibilities heavily involve developing production-grade ML systems, data pipelines, and MLOps practices, which are central to the ML Engineer role.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems' directly relates to managing data infrastructure and processing.
job_tasks.phrase: Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems

job_tasks.justification: The job description explicitly mentions 'leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations' and the need for 'ML engineering, model design, and training', which are core modeling activities.
job_tasks.phrase: leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'ML engineering, model design, and training', which are fundamental aspects of creating and refining machine learning models.
job_tasks.phrase: ML engineering, model design, and training

job_tasks.justification: The responsibility to 'Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines' and 'Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices' points to traditional software development practices applied to ML systems.
job_tasks.phrase: Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines

job_tasks.justification: The requirement to 'Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries' is a direct indication of software development responsibilities.
job_tasks.phrase: Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Choose the right technology or coding methodology and refactor and simplify code when necessary' describes typical software development tasks.
job_tasks.phrase: Choose the right technology or coding methodology and refactor and simplify code when necessary

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'security-aware user-facing software systems' in the context of GenAI Engineer profile, and the general need to build systems, implies software development for user interaction.
job_tasks.phrase: building production-grade security-aware user-facing software systems

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines, accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining' covers key MLOps concerns.
job_tasks.phrase: accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining

job_tasks.justification: The responsibility to 'Take full ownership of services end-to-end by actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact. Set relevant service level objectives (SLOs) and act accordingly when they are not met' is a core MLOps function.
job_tasks.phrase: Take full ownership of services end-to-end by actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact. Set relevant service level objectives (SLOs) and act accordingly when they are not met

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'ML governance processes' falls under the operational management and oversight of ML systems.

The role involves 'collecting business requirements from product stakeholders' and 'Evaluate possible architecture solutions considering business and technology requirements', which demonstrates understanding of business needs.
job_tasks.phrase: collecting business requirements from product stakeholders

job_tasks.justification: Evaluating architecture solutions based on business requirements is a key aspect of understanding the business context.
job_tasks.phrase: Evaluate possible architecture solutions considering business and technology requirements

work closely together with the other Machine Learning Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers as well as with Data Engineers, Software Engineers and Product Managers
Coach others through evidence and clear communication, explaining advanced technical concepts in simpler terms

Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies and upskilling as needed
communicating ideas in clear coherent language, and practicing active listening
